sn42.13:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā koliyesu viharati uttaraṃ nāma koliyānaṃ nigamo.
sn42.13:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Koliyans, where they have a town named Uttara.

sn42.13:1.2.pli: Atha kho pāṭaliyo gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho pāṭaliyo gāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn42.13:1.2.eng: Then Pāṭaliya the chief went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn42.13:2.1.pli: Ye te, bhante, evamāhaṃsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo māyaṃ jānātī’ti, kacci te, bhante, bhagavato vuttavādino, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākaronti, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchati?
sn42.13:2.1.eng: Do those who say this repeat what the Buddha has said, and not misrepresent him with an untruth? Is their explanation in line with the teaching? Are there any legitimate grounds for rebuttal and criticism?

sn42.13:2.2.eng: For we don’t want to misrepresent the Blessed One.”

sn42.13:2.3.pli: “Ye te, gāmaṇi, evamāhaṃsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo māyaṃ jānātī’ti, vuttavādino ceva me, te na ca maṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākaronti, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchatī”ti.
sn42.13:2.3.eng: “Chief, those who say this repeat what I have said, and don’t misrepresent me with an untruth. Their explanation is in line with the teaching, and there are no legitimate grounds for rebuttal and criticism.”

sn42.13:2.4.pli: “Saccaṃyeva kira, bho, mayaṃ tesaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ na saddahāma:
sn42.13:2.4.eng: “Sir, we didn’t believe that what those ascetics and brahmins said was really true.

sn42.13:2.5.pli: ‘samaṇo gotamo māyaṃ jānātī’ti, samaṇo khalu bho gotamo māyāvī”ti.
sn42.13:2.5.eng: But it seems the ascetic Gotama is deceitful!”

sn42.13:2.6.pli: “Yo nu kho, gāmaṇi, evaṃ vadeti: ‘ahaṃ māyaṃ jānāmī’ti, so evaṃ vadeti: ‘ahaṃ māyāvī’”ti.
sn42.13:2.6.eng: “Chief, does someone who says ‘I know deceit’ also say ‘I am deceitful’?”

sn42.13:2.7.pli: “Tatheva taṃ bhagavā hoti, tatheva taṃ sugata hotī”ti.
sn42.13:2.7.eng: “That’s right, Blessed One! That’s right, Holy One!”

sn42.13:2.8.pli: “Tena hi, gāmaṇi, taññevettha paṭipucchissāmi; yathā te khameyya, tathā taṃ byākareyyāsi—
sn42.13:2.8.eng: “Well then, chief, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.

sn42.13:3.2.eng: Do you know the Koliyan officers with drooping headdresses?”

sn42.13:3.4.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi, kimatthiyā koliyānaṃ lambacūḷakā bhaṭā”ti?

sn42.13:3.5.pli: “Ye ca, bhante, koliyānaṃ corā te ca paṭisedhetuṃ, yāni ca koliyānaṃ dūteyyāni tāni ca vahātuṃ, etadatthiyā, bhante, koliyānaṃ lambacūḷakā bhaṭā”ti.
sn42.13:3.5.eng: “To put a stop to bandits and to deliver messages for the Koliyans.”

sn42.13:3.7.pli: jānāsi tvaṃ koliyānaṃ lambacūḷake bhaṭe sīlavante vā te dussīle vā”ti?
sn42.13:3.7.eng: Are the Koliyan officers with drooping headdresses moral or immoral?”

sn42.13:3.8.pli: “Jānāmahaṃ, bhante, koliyānaṃ lambacūḷake bhaṭe dussīle pāpadhamme; ye ca loke dussīlā pāpadhammā koliyānaṃ lambacūḷakā bhaṭā tesaṃ aññatarā”ti.
sn42.13:3.8.eng: “I know that they’re immoral, of bad character, sir. They are among those in the world who are immoral and of bad character.”

sn42.13:3.9.eng: “Would it be right to say that

sn42.13:3.10.pli: ‘pāṭaliyo gāmaṇi jānāti koliyānaṃ lambacūḷake bhaṭe dussīle pāpadhamme, pāṭaliyopi gāmaṇi dussīlo pāpadhammo’ti, sammā nu kho so vadamāno vadeyyā”ti?
sn42.13:3.10.eng: Pāṭaliya knows the Kolyian officers with drooping headdresses who are immoral, of bad character, so he too must be immoral and of bad character?”

sn42.13:3.12.pli: Aññe, bhante, koliyānaṃ lambacūḷakā bhaṭā, aññohamasmi. Aññathādhammā koliyānaṃ lambacūḷakā bhaṭā, aññathādhammohamasmī”ti.
sn42.13:3.12.eng: I’m quite different from the Koliyan officers with drooping headdresses, we have quite different characters.”

sn42.13:3.13.pli: “Tvañhi nāma, gāmaṇi, lacchasi: ‘pāṭaliyo gāmaṇi jānāti koliyānaṃ lambacūḷake bhaṭe dussīle pāpadhamme, na ca pāṭaliyo gāmaṇi dussīlo pāpadhammo’ti, kasmā tathāgato na lacchati: ‘tathāgato māyaṃ jānāti, na ca tathāgato māyāvī’ti?
sn42.13:3.13.eng: “So if you can know those officers of bad character while you are not of bad character, why can’t the Realized One know deceit, without being deceitful?

sn42.13:3.14.pli: Māyañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, māyāya ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca māyāvī kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.
sn42.13:3.14.eng: I understand deceit and its result. And I understand how the deceitful practice so that when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn42.13:4.1.pli: Pāṇātipātañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, pāṇātipātassa ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca pāṇātipātī kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.
sn42.13:4.1.eng: I understand killing living creatures and its result. And I understand how those who kill living creatures practice so that when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn42.13:4.2.pli: Adinnādānañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, adinnādānassa ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca adinnādāyī kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.3.pli: Kāmesumicchācārañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, kāmesumicchācārassa ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca kāmesumicchācārī kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.4.pli: Musāvādañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, musāvādassa ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca musāvādī kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.5.pli: Pisuṇavācañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, pisuṇavācāya ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca pisuṇavāco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.6.pli: Pharusavācañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, pharusavācāya ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca pharusavāco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.7.pli: Samphappalāpañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, samphappalāpassa ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca samphappalāpī kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.8.pli: Abhijjhañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, abhijjhāya ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca abhijjhālu kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.9.pli: Byāpādapadosañcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, byāpādapadosassa ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca byāpannacitto kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.

sn42.13:4.10.pli: Micchādiṭṭhiñcāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, pajānāmi, micchādiṭṭhiyā ca vipākaṃ, yathāpaṭipanno ca micchādiṭṭhiko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañca pajānāmi.
sn42.13:4.10.eng: wrong view and its result. And I understand how those who have wrong view practice so that when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn42.13:5.1.pli: Santi hi, gāmaṇi, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino:
sn42.13:5.1.eng: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:

sn42.13:5.2.pli: ‘yo koci pāṇamatipāteti, sabbo so diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
sn42.13:5.2.eng: ‘Everyone who kills living creatures experiences pain and sadness in this very life.

sn42.13:5.3.pli: Yo koci adinnaṃ ādiyati, sabbo so diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.

sn42.13:5.4.pli: Yo koci kāmesu micchā carati, sabbo so diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.

sn42.13:5.5.pli: Yo koci musā bhaṇati, sabbo so diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayatī’ti.
sn42.13:5.5.eng: lies experiences pain and sadness in this very life.’

sn42.13:6.1.pli: Dissati kho pana, gāmaṇi, idhekacco mālī kuṇḍalī sunhāto suvilitto kappitakesamassu itthikāmehi rājā maññe paricārento.
sn42.13:6.1.eng: But you can see someone, garlanded and adorned, nicely bathed and anointed, hair and beard dressed, taking his pleasure with women as if he were a king.

sn42.13:6.3.pli: ‘ambho, ayaṃ puriso kiṃ akāsi mālī kuṇḍalī sunhāto suvilitto kappitakesamassu itthikāmehi rājā maññe paricāretī’ti?
sn42.13:6.3.eng: ‘Worthy man, what did that man do?’

sn42.13:6.5.pli: ‘ambho, ayaṃ puriso rañño paccatthikaṃ pasayha jīvitā voropesi.
sn42.13:6.5.eng: ‘Worthy man, that man attacked the king’s enemy and killed them.

sn42.13:6.6.eng: The king was delighted and gave him this reward.

sn42.13:6.7.pli: Tenāyaṃ puriso mālī kuṇḍalī sunhāto suvilitto kappitakesamassu, itthikāmehi rājā maññe paricāretī’ti.
sn42.13:6.7.eng: That’s why he’s garlanded and adorned, nicely bathed and anointed, hair and beard dressed, taking his pleasure with women as if he were a king.’

sn42.13:7.1.pli: Dissati kho, gāmaṇi, idhekacco daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinetvā, dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā, dakkhiṇato nagarassa sīsaṃ chijjamāno.
sn42.13:7.1.eng: And you can see someone else, his arms tied tightly behind his back with a strong rope. His head is shaven and he’s marched from street to street and from square to square to the beating of a harsh drum. Then he’s taken out the south gate and there, to the south of the city, they chop off his head.

sn42.13:7.3.pli: ‘ambho, ayaṃ puriso kiṃ akāsi, daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinetvā dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā dakkhiṇato nagarassa sīsaṃ chindatī’ti?
sn42.13:7.3.eng: ‘Worthy man, what did that man do?’

sn42.13:7.5.pli: ‘ambho, ayaṃ puriso rājaverī itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā jīvitā voropesi,
sn42.13:7.5.eng: ‘Worthy man, that man is an enemy of the king, and he has murdered a man or a woman.

sn42.13:7.6.pli: tena naṃ rājāno gahetvā evarūpaṃ kammakāraṇaṃ kārentī’ti.
sn42.13:7.6.eng: That’s why the rulers arrested him and inflicted such punishment.’

sn42.13:8.2.pli: api nu te evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā”ti?
sn42.13:8.2.eng: Have you seen or heard of such a thing?”

sn42.13:8.3.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

sn42.13:8.4.pli: “Tatra, gāmaṇi, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino:
sn42.13:8.4.eng: “Since this is so, the ascetics and brahmins whose view is that

sn42.13:8.5.pli: ‘yo koci pāṇamatipāteti, sabbo so diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayatī’ti, saccaṃ vā te āhaṃsu musā vā”ti?
sn42.13:8.5.eng: everyone who kills living creatures experiences pain and sadness in this very life: are they right or wrong?”

sn42.13:8.7.pli: “Ye pana te tucchaṃ musā vilapanti, sīlavanto vā te dussīlā vā”ti?
sn42.13:8.7.eng: “But those who speak hollow, false nonsense: are they moral or immoral?”

sn42.13:8.9.pli: “Ye pana te dussīlā pāpadhammā micchāpaṭipannā vā te sammāpaṭipannā vā”ti?
sn42.13:8.9.eng: “And are those who are immoral, of bad character practicing wrongly or rightly?”

sn42.13:8.11.pli: “Ye pana te micchāpaṭipannā micchādiṭṭhikā vā te sammādiṭṭhikā vā”ti?
sn42.13:8.11.eng: “And do those who are practicing wrongly have wrong view or right view?”

sn42.13:8.13.pli: “Ye pana te micchādiṭṭhikā kallaṃ nu tesu pasīditun”ti?
sn42.13:8.13.eng: “But is it appropriate to have confidence in those of wrong view?”

sn42.13:14.3.pli: ‘ambho, ayaṃ puriso kiṃ akāsi daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinetvā, dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā, dakkhiṇato nagarassa sīsaṃ chindatī’ti?

sn42.13:14.5.pli: ‘ambho, ayaṃ puriso gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā musāvādena atthaṃ bhañji,
sn42.13:14.5.eng: ‘Worthy man, that man has ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.

sn42.13:14.6.pli: tena naṃ rājāno gahetvā evarūpaṃ kammakāraṇaṃ kārentī’ti.
sn42.13:14.6.eng: That’s why the rulers arrested him and inflicted such punishment.’

sn42.13:14.8.pli: api nu te evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā”ti?
sn42.13:14.8.eng: Have you seen or heard of such a thing?”

sn42.13:14.9.eng: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

sn42.13:14.10.pli: “Tatra, gāmaṇi, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino:
sn42.13:14.10.eng: “Since this is so, the ascetics and brahmins whose view is that

sn42.13:14.11.pli: ‘yo koci musā bhaṇati, sabbo so diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayatī’ti, saccaṃ vā te āhaṃsu musā vā”ti?
sn42.13:14.11.eng: everyone who lies experiences pain and sadness in this very life: are they right or wrong?”

sn42.13:14.13.pli: “Ye pana te tucchaṃ musā vilapanti sīlavanto vā te dussīlā vā”ti?
sn42.13:14.13.eng: “But those who speak hollow, false nonsense: are they moral or immoral?”

sn42.13:14.15.pli: “Ye pana te dussīlā pāpadhammā micchāpaṭipannā vā te sammāpaṭipannā vā”ti?
sn42.13:14.15.eng: “And are those who are immoral, of bad character practicing wrongly or rightly?”

sn42.13:14.17.pli: “Ye pana te micchāpaṭipannā micchādiṭṭhikā vā te sammādiṭṭhikā vā”ti?
sn42.13:14.17.eng: “And do those who are practicing wrongly have wrong view or right view?”

sn42.13:14.19.pli: “Ye pana te micchādiṭṭhikā kallaṃ nu tesu pasīditun”ti?
sn42.13:14.19.eng: “But is it appropriate to have confidence in those of wrong view?”

sn42.13:15.3.pli: Tattha atthi mañcakāni, atthi āsanāni, atthi udakamaṇiko, atthi telappadīpo.
sn42.13:15.3.eng: where there are cots, seats, water jars, and oil lamps.

sn42.13:15.4.pli: Tattha yo samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā vāsaṃ upeti, tenāhaṃ yathāsatti yathābalaṃ saṃvibhajāmi.
sn42.13:15.4.eng: Whenever an ascetic or brahmin comes to stay, I share what I have as best I can.

sn42.13:15.5.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhante, cattāro satthāro nānādiṭṭhikā nānākhantikā nānārucikā, tasmiṃ āvasathāgāre vāsaṃ upagacchuṃ.
sn42.13:15.5.eng: Once it so happened, sir, that four teachers of different views, beliefs, and opinions came to stay at my guest house.

sn42.13:16.1.eng: One teacher had this doctrine and view:

sn42.13:16.2.pli: ‘natthi dinnaṃ, natthi yiṭṭhaṃ, natthi hutaṃ, natthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko. Natthi ayaṃ loko, natthi paro loko, natthi mātā, natthi pitā, natthi sattā opapātikā, natthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
sn42.13:16.2.eng: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings. There’s no fruit or result of good and bad deeds. There’s no afterlife. There’s no such thing as mother and father, or beings that are reborn spontaneously. And there’s no ascetic or brahmin who is rightly comported and rightly practiced, and who describes the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.’

sn42.13:17.1.eng: One teacher had this doctrine and view:

sn42.13:17.2.pli: ‘atthi dinnaṃ, atthi yiṭṭhaṃ, atthi hutaṃ, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, atthi ayaṃ loko, atthi paro loko, atthi mātā, atthi pitā, atthi sattā opapātikā, atthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā, ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.

sn42.13:18.1.eng: One teacher had this doctrine and view:

sn42.13:18.2.pli: ‘karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato, pāṇamatipātayato, adinnaṃ ādiyato, sandhiṃ chindato, nillopaṃ harato, ekāgārikaṃ karoto, paripanthe tiṭṭhato, paradāraṃ gacchato, musā bhaṇato, karoto na karīyati pāpaṃ.
sn42.13:18.2.eng: ‘The one who acts does nothing wrong when they punish, mutilate, torture, aggrieve, oppress, intimidate, or when they encourage others to do the same. Nothing bad is done when they kill, steal, break into houses, plunder wealth, steal from isolated buildings, commit highway robbery, commit adultery, and lie.

sn42.13:18.3.pli: Khurapariyantena cepi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kareyya, natthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, natthi pāpassa āgamo.
sn42.13:18.3.eng: If you were to reduce all the living creatures of this earth to one heap and mass of flesh with a razor-edged chakram, no evil comes of that, and no outcome of evil.

sn42.13:18.4.pli: Dakkhiṇañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṃ gaccheyya hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācāpento, natthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, natthi pāpassa āgamo.
sn42.13:18.4.eng: If you were to go along the south bank of the Ganges killing, mutilating, and torturing, and encouraging others to do the same, no evil comes of that, and no outcome of evil.

sn42.13:18.5.pli: Uttarañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṃ gaccheyya dadanto dāpento yajanto yajāpento, natthi tatonidānaṃ puññaṃ, natthi puññassa āgamo.
sn42.13:18.5.eng: If you were to go along the north bank of the Ganges giving and sacrificing and encouraging others to do the same, no merit comes of that, and no outcome of merit.

sn42.13:18.6.pli: Dānena damena saṃyamena saccavajjena natthi puññaṃ, natthi puññassa āgamo’ti.
sn42.13:18.6.eng: In giving, self-control, restraint, and truthfulness there is no merit or outcome of merit.’

sn42.13:19.5.eng: If you were to go along the north bank of the Ganges giving and sacrificing and encouraging others to do the same, merit comes of that, and an outcome of merit.

sn42.13:20.1.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, ahudeva kaṅkhā, ahu vicikicchā:
sn42.13:20.1.eng: I had doubt and uncertainty about that:

sn42.13:20.2.pli: ‘kosu nāma imesaṃ bhavataṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ saccaṃ āha, ko musā’”ti?
sn42.13:20.2.eng: ‘I wonder who of these respected ascetics and brahmins speaks the truth, and who speaks falsehood?’”

sn42.13:21.1.eng: “Chief, no wonder you’re doubting and uncertain.

sn42.13:21.2.pli: Kaṅkhanīye ca pana te ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā”ti.
sn42.13:21.2.eng: Doubt has come up in you about an uncertain matter.”

sn42.13:21.3.pli: “Evaṃ pasannohaṃ, bhante, bhagavati. Pahoti me bhagavā tathā dhammaṃ desetuṃ yathāhaṃ imaṃ kaṅkhādhammaṃ pajaheyyan”ti.
sn42.13:21.3.eng: “I am quite confident that the Buddha is capable of teaching me so that I can give up this state of uncertainty.”

sn42.13:22.1.eng: “Chief, there is immersion based on understanding of principle.

sn42.13:22.2.pli: Tatra ce tvaṃ cittasamādhiṃ paṭilabheyyāsi. Evaṃ tvaṃ imaṃ kaṅkhādhammaṃ pajaheyyāsi.
sn42.13:22.2.eng: If you gain such mental immersion, you can give up that state of uncertainty.

sn42.13:22.3.eng: And what is immersion based on understanding of principle?

sn42.13:22.4.pli: Idha, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācāraṃ pahāya kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti, abhijjhaṃ pahāya anabhijjhālu hoti, byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto hoti, micchādiṭṭhiṃ pahāya sammādiṭṭhiko hoti.
sn42.13:22.4.eng: It’s when a noble disciple has given up killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, talking nonsense, covetousness, ill will, and wrong view.

sn42.13:23.1.pli: Sa kho so, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako evaṃ vigatābhijjho vigatabyāpādo asammūḷho sampajāno paṭissato mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
sn42.13:23.1.eng: Then that noble disciple is rid of desire, rid of ill will, unconfused, aware, and mindful. They meditate spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

sn42.13:23.3.eng: ‘That teacher who had this doctrine and view:

sn42.13:23.4.pli: “natthi dinnaṃ, natthi yiṭṭhaṃ, natthi hutaṃ, natthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, natthi ayaṃ loko, natthi paro loko, natthi mātā, natthi pitā, natthi sattā opapātikā, natthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā, sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī”ti.

sn42.13:23.5.eng: If what this good teacher says is true, it’s a safe bet for me to not hurt any creature firm or frail.

sn42.13:23.6.eng: I hold a perfect hand on both counts, since I’m restrained in body, speech, and mind, and when my body breaks up, after death, I’ll be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’

sn42.13:23.9.eng: When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil.

sn42.13:23.10.eng: When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss.

sn42.13:23.11.eng: And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.

sn42.13:23.12.eng: This is that immersion based on understanding of principle.

sn42.13:26.1.pli: Sa kho so, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako evaṃ vigatābhijjho vigatabyāpādo asammūḷho sampajāno paṭissato mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
sn42.13:26.1.eng: Then that noble disciple is rid of desire, rid of ill will, unconfused, aware, and mindful. They meditate spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

sn42.13:26.3.eng: ‘That teacher who had this doctrine and view:

sn42.13:26.4.pli: “karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato, pāṇamatipātayato, adinnaṃ ādiyato, sandhiṃ chindato, nillopaṃ harato, ekāgārikaṃ karoto, paripanthe tiṭṭhato, paradāraṃ gacchato, musā bhaṇato, karoto karīyati pāpaṃ.
sn42.13:26.4.eng: “The one who acts does a bad deed when they punish, mutilate, torture, aggrieve, oppress, intimidate, or when they encourage others to do the same. A bad deed is done when they kill, steal, break into houses, plunder wealth, steal from isolated buildings, commit highway robbery, commit adultery, and lie.

sn42.13:26.5.pli: Khurapariyantena cepi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kareyya, atthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, atthi pāpassa āgamo.
sn42.13:26.5.eng: If you were to reduce all the living creatures of this earth to one heap and mass of flesh with a razor-edged chakram, evil comes of that, and an outcome of evil.

sn42.13:26.6.pli: Dakkhiṇañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṃ gaccheyya hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācāpento, atthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, atthi pāpassa āgamo.
sn42.13:26.6.eng: If you were to go along the south bank of the Ganges killing, mutilating, and torturing, and encouraging others to do the same, evil comes of that, and an outcome of evil.

sn42.13:26.7.pli: Uttarañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṃ gaccheyya dadanto dāpento, yajanto yajāpento, atthi tatonidānaṃ puññaṃ, atthi puññassa āgamo.
sn42.13:26.7.eng: If you were to go along the north bank of the Ganges giving and sacrificing and encouraging others to do the same, merit comes of that, and an outcome of merit.

sn42.13:26.8.pli: Dānena damena saṃyamena saccavajjena atthi puññaṃ atthi puññassa āgamo”ti.
sn42.13:26.8.eng: In giving, self-control, restraint, and truthfulness there is merit and outcome of merit.”

sn42.13:26.9.pli: Sace tassa bhoto satthuno saccaṃ vacanaṃ, apaṇṇakatāya mayhaṃ, yvāhaṃ na kiñci byābādhemi tasaṃ vā thāvaraṃ vā?
sn42.13:26.9.eng: If what this good teacher says is true, it’s a safe bet for me to not hurt any creature firm or frail.

sn42.13:26.10.pli: Ubhayamettha kaṭaggāho, yaṃ camhi kāyena saṃvuto vācāya saṃvuto manasā saṃvuto, yañca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmī’ti.
sn42.13:26.10.eng: I hold a perfect hand on both counts, since I’m restrained in body, speech, and mind, and when my body breaks up, after death, I’ll be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’

sn42.13:26.13.eng: When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil.

sn42.13:26.14.eng: When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss.

sn42.13:26.15.eng: And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.

sn42.13:26.16.eng: This is that immersion based on understanding of principle.
